job_title: Assistant Director in Kansas City, MO
pros: Good working environment, flexible to a point, ability to work with students in and out of department.
cons: Very secretive and sneaky. Even if you think you are doing a good job and have had good reviews... they could blindside you with a lay off or termination. If you aren't all in with the mission or direction the University is moving you might find yourself on the outs.

review_title: Great culture and awesome people. The best place to work in KC higher ed.

Pay could be better, but the benefits and environment make up for it.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Kansas City, MO
pros: Excellent University.  Small school environment where instructors feel compelled toward student success.
cons: Not many negatives.  Pay can be modest but if you are in it for the pay then you are teaching for the wrong reason.

review_title: Great people and just the right size
job_title: Director of Program in Kansas City, MO
pros: Friendly and connected campus, small class sizes, decent benefits for full-time. Student activities is highly invested in making undergraduate experience rich and rewarding.
cons: Antiquated faculty not open to current needs of new generations of students.

job_title: Academic Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: Many friendly people, great students. Small community which has some pluses. Easy and free parking. Safe campus. Good cafeteria food!
cons: Cliquish staff; HR is horrible to deal w/; no employee support; poor staff communication; supervisors have been there awhile and get away w/ unethical actions regularly.
